activities.name: Arrive in Cape Town & Transfer to Hotel
activities.description: Welcome to Cape Town! Upon arrival at CPT Airport, clear immigration, collect your baggage. Use Uber/Bolt (approx. 20-30 mins, R250-R350) or a pre-booked transfer to your hotel. Check in, drop your bags, and get ready to explore.
activities.address: Cape Town International Airport (CPT) to City Hotel
activities.location_string_for_grab: Your Hotel in Cape Town City Centre
activities.transport_options: Uber, Bolt, Airport Shuttle, Pre-booked Transfer.
activities.halal_notes: A prayer facility is available at CPT Airport in the international arrivals terminal.

activities.name: Lunch at Time Out Market
activities.description: After settling in (around 1:00 PM), head straight to the V&A Waterfront. Your first stop is the Time Out Market, a massive, vibrant food hall featuring curated stalls from Cape Town's best chefs. The variety is huge, ensuring you'll find something amazing to kick off your culinary journey.
activities.address: The Old Power Station, Building 19, V&A Waterfront
activities.halal_notes: Multiple vendors have excellent seafood or vegetarian dishes. 'Conscious Carnivores' offers fully halal grilled meats.

activities.name: Explore the Waterfront & Play Cave Golf
activities.description: Walk off lunch by exploring the V&A Waterfront. Browse the unique local design stalls at The Watershed market. Then, challenge each other to a round of Cave Golf, a quirky 18-hole mini-golf course set inside a man-made cave. It's surprisingly fun and a bit different from the usual attractions.
activities.address: V&A Waterfront, below the Scratch Patch
activities.transport_options: Walking distance from Time Out Market.
activities.halal_notes: Prayer room (Salaah Khana) is available in the main Victoria Wharf Shopping Centre for your convenience. [37]

activities.name: Board Game Fun at Fanaticus
activities.description: For a chill late afternoon, head to Fanaticus Games. It's a fantastic board game store where you can browse a huge collection of games, from popular titles to indie gems. A great spot for anyone with a nerdy interest to unwind.
activities.address: Stadium on Main, Main Road, Claremont
activities.halal_notes: A relaxed, alcohol-free environment focused on gaming.

activities.name: Dinner at a Halal Gem
activities.description: Claremont and the surrounding Southern Suburbs are hubs for excellent halal food. For dinner, indulge at a top-rated spot like The Butcher's Wife for amazing steaks and grills, or Izzy Burger for some of the best burgers in the city. A delicious end to a varied first day.
activities.halal_notes: Both The Butcher's Wife and Izzy Burger are fully halal-certified and highly recommended by locals. [2]

activities.name: Arrive in Cape Town & Transfer to Hotel
activities.description: Welcome! Arrive at CPT Airport and transfer to your hotel. After checking in, this route dives straight into the cultural and creative heart of the city.
activities.address: Cape Town International Airport (CPT) to City Hotel
activities.location_string_for_grab: Your Hotel in Cape Town City Centre
activities.halal_notes: Prayer facility is available at CPT Airport.

activities.name: Authentic Cape Malay Lunch in Bo-Kaap
activities.description: Head to the historic Bo-Kaap, the heart of Cape Town's Muslim community. Enjoy an authentic Cape Malay lunch at Biesmiellah or the home-style cooking of Faeeza's Home Kitchen. The flavours here are unique to Cape Town - a delicious blend of sweet, savoury, and aromatic spices.
activities.halal_notes: Nearly all eateries in Bo-Kaap are halal. You can visit the Auwal Mosque, the oldest in South Africa, just a few steps away. [36]

activities.name: Explore Bo-Kaap & Find a Great Coffee
activities.description: After lunch, wander through the vibrant, colourful streets of Bo-Kaap. From there, take a short walk to find one of Cape Town's top coffee spots. Your friend recommended Origin Coffee Roasting - it's a short Uber ride away and considered one of the pioneers of specialty coffee in the city.
activities.transport_options: Walk from Bo-Kaap or short Uber.

activities.name: Creative Fun at Clay Cafe in the City
activities.description: In the afternoon, get your creative juices flowing at Clay Cafe on Bree Street. Choose a ceramic piece and spend a couple of hours painting your own masterpiece. It's a super relaxing and fun activity, and you get a unique souvenir (collect it a few days later after firing).
activities.address: 199 Bree Street, Cape Town City Centre
activities.transport_options: Short Uber ride or a longer walk.
activities.halal_notes: They serve food and drinks, but with many halal options nearby, you can focus on the painting.

activities.name: Sunset Views from Signal Hill
activities.description: As evening approaches, take an Uber up to Signal Hill to watch your first Cape Town sunset. Find a spot and watch as the sun dips into the Atlantic Ocean, painting the sky with colour and lighting up the city below. It's a classic Cape Town experience for a reason.
activities.transport_options: Uber/Bolt is easiest. It can be busy, so arrange your ride back.
activities.halal_notes: A beautiful, tranquil spot for evening prayers if you bring a mat.

activities.name: Dinner on Bree Street
activities.description: After sunset, head back down to the vibrant Bree Street for dinner. This street is a foodie paradise. For a great halal option, check out 'The Butcher's Grill' or 'Nouveau Coffee & Grill' for delicious steaks and contemporary dishes.
activities.halal_notes: Both 'The Butcher's Grill' and 'Nouveau' are fully halal-certified.

activities.name: Table Mountain Cableway
activities.description: Start early (be there by 8:00 AM to beat the crowds) and take the rotating cable car to the top of Table Mountain, one of the New7Wonders of Nature. The 5-minute ride offers incredible 360° views. At the summit, walk the easy trails and enjoy breathtaking panoramas.
activities.halal_notes: The cafe at the top offers snacks. A quiet spot on the summit provides a serene place for prayer with an unparalleled view.

activities.name: Kirstenbosch Botanical Gardens
activities.description: After the mountain, head to Kirstenbosch National Botanical Garden. Spend the afternoon strolling through indigenous flora, walking the Centenary Tree Canopy Walkway (the 'Boomslang'), and enjoying the peaceful atmosphere on the eastern slopes of Table Mountain.
activities.halal_notes: The on-site restaurants offer vegetarian/seafood options. A small prayer room is available near the main entrance; ask at the visitor center.

activities.name: Dinner at Andalousse Moroccan Cuisine
activities.description: For a memorable dinner, experience the authentic flavours of Morocco at Andalousse in Woodstock. This fully halal restaurant is known for its incredible tagines, couscous, and warm, traditional decor. It's a culinary trip within a trip.
activities.halal_notes: Fully halal-certified, offering an authentic and highly-rated dining experience. [2]

activities.name: Sunrise Hike up Lion's Head
activities.description: An early start for a sunrise hike up Lion's Head is an unforgettable experience. It's a moderate 60-90 minute climb with some scrambling (ladders and chains, with an easier alternative route). The 360° views as the sun rises are absolutely worth the effort.
activities.halal_notes: Bring water and snacks for a post-hike reward.

activities.name: Post-Hike Breakfast & Sea Point Promenade
activities.description: After your hike, head to Sea Point for a well-deserved breakfast. Then, take a leisurely stroll or rent an Up Cycles bike to explore the Sea Point Promenade, a beautiful walkway along the Atlantic with public art and fresh sea air.
activities.halal_notes: Many cafes have vegetarian options. The famous Nuri Sushi is a fully halal spot perfect for lunch in Sea Point.

activities.name: Paragliding from Signal Hill
activities.description: For an afternoon thrill, go tandem paragliding from Signal Hill. You'll be strapped to an experienced pilot as you soar over Sea Point, enjoying bird's-eye views of the coastline and city before landing gently on the promenade. It's pure, quiet exhilaration.
activities.transport_options: Most companies provide transport to the launch site.

activities.name: Mojo Market & Moro Gelato
activities.description: After landing, celebrate at the Mojo Market, a bustling indoor food market with over 30 stalls and live music. Grab a late lunch or snack. Afterwards, treat yourselves to the best ice cream in Cape Town at Moro Gelato just down the road.
activities.address: 30 Regent Road, Sea Point, Cape Town
activities.transport_options: Walking distance from the landing zone.
activities.halal_notes: Diverse vendors offer plenty of seafood/vegetarian options to choose from. [46]

activities.name: District Six Museum & Coffee
activities.description: Start your day with a powerful history lesson at the District Six Museum, which tells the story of the forced removal of residents from this vibrant inner-city area during Apartheid. It's a deeply moving and important experience. Afterwards, decompress with a coffee at a nearby artisanal cafe like Truth Coffee, known for its steampunk decor and world-class coffee.

activities.name: Cat Heaven at Cat Café
activities.description: For a dose of cuteness, spend some time at Cat Heaven, Cape Town's cat café. Pay a small entrance fee to hang out with rescue cats in a cozy environment. It's a relaxing and heartwarming way to spend an hour, especially if you're animal lovers.
activities.halal_notes: A wholesome, fun activity. They serve light snacks and drinks.

activities.name: Iziko Planetarium Show
activities.description: Head back to the city and journey through the cosmos at the Iziko Planetarium. The state-of-the-art digital dome offers immersive shows about astronomy and the universe. It’s a fascinating and awe-inspiring experience, perfect for a chill afternoon.

activities.name: Movie Night at The Labia Theatre
activities.description: For the evening, experience Cape Town's oldest independent cinema, The Labia Theatre. It has a wonderful, old-school charm and shows a mix of indie, foreign, and classic films. You can even take your drink into the cinema. It’s a unique and cozy movie experience.
activities.halal_notes: Have dinner before or after on nearby Kloof Street.

activities.name: Drive Chapman's Peak & Hout Bay
activities.description: Hire a car or driver for an epic road trip. Start by driving the breathtaking Chapman's Peak Drive, a winding road carved into the cliffside with incredible ocean views. Stop in Hout Bay to see the harbour and maybe take a quick boat trip to see the seal colony on Duiker Island.
activities.address: Chapman's Peak Drive, between Hout Bay and Noordhoek
activities.transport_options: Self-drive or private tour is best.

activities.name: Cape Point & Cape of Good Hope
activities.description: Continue to the Cape Point Nature Reserve. Take the Flying Dutchman Funicular up to the old lighthouse for dramatic cliff views. Then, visit the Cape of Good Hope, the most south-western point of Africa. Watch out for ostriches and baboons!
activities.address: Cape Point Nature Reserve, Cape Peninsula
activities.halal_notes: Pack a picnic or check the Two Oceans Restaurant for seafood/vegetarian options.

activities.name: Boulders Beach Penguin Colony
activities.description: The absolute highlight for many. Visit Boulders Beach to see the charming colony of wild African Penguins. A boardwalk takes you right next to the beach where they nest, waddle, and swim. It's an amazing and fun wildlife encounter.
activities.halal_notes: There's a mosque in Simon's Town (Masjid Boorhanu's-Deen) for prayer.

activities.name: Kalk Bay & Return Drive
activities.description: On the way back, stop in the bohemian fishing village of Kalk Bay. Browse the quirky shops and art galleries. For an early dinner, enjoy fresh fish and chips at the famous Kalky's right on the harbour.
activities.address: Kalk Bay Harbour, Main Road, Kalk Bay
activities.transport_options: Drive along the False Bay coast.
activities.halal_notes: Kalky's is a classic seafood spot. Confirm with them what oil they use for frying.

activities.name: Muizenberg Beach & Surf Lesson
activities.description: Head to the False Bay coast and start your day at Muizenberg, famous for its colourful beach huts and gentle waves. It's the perfect place to take a 90-minute beginner's surf lesson together. Super fun, and great for a laugh.
activities.halal_notes: The water here is warmer than the Atlantic side!

activities.name: Scratch Patch & Mineral World
activities.description: After surfing, head to Simon's Town and visit the Scratch Patch. It's a simple but surprisingly fun activity where you can sift through millions of polished gemstones and pick your favourites to take home. A cool, tangible memory of your trip.

activities.name: Sea Kayaking with Penguins
activities.description: In the afternoon, experience the penguins from a different perspective. A guided sea kayaking trip from Simon's Town harbour takes you paddling towards Boulders Beach, offering a unique water-level view of the colony. You might also see seals and other marine life.
activities.halal_notes: A respectful and amazing way to see the wildlife.

activities.name: Dinner at The Victorian Goose
activities.description: End your coastal day with dinner in Simon's Town. The Victorian Goose is a highly-rated, fully halal restaurant offering delicious grills, seafood, and cozy ambiance in a historic building. A perfect, relaxed end to the day.
activities.halal_notes: Fully halal-certified, offering peace of mind and great food. [2]

activities.name: Babylonstoren Garden Exploration
activities.description: Take a day trip to the Winelands (approx. 1-hour drive). Start at Babylonstoren. Spend the morning wandering its magnificent, themed gardens. Explore the fruit orchards, vegetable patches, prickly pear maze, and succulent house. It is a world-class experience.
activities.halal_notes: This route focuses on the beauty and food of the Winelands, not alcohol.

activities.name: Lunch at The Greenhouse or Babel
activities.description: For lunch, dine at Babylonstoren. The Greenhouse is casual, set within the gardens. For a more formal, farm-to-fork fine dining experience, book a table at Babel (reservations are essential weeks in advance). Both offer incredible, fresh, seasonal food.
activities.halal_notes: Many vegetarian and seafood options. Inform them of your dietary needs when booking.

activities.name: Explore Franschhoek & Chocolate Tasting
activities.description: In the afternoon, drive to the picturesque town of Franschhoek. Stroll down the main street, browse the art galleries, and see the Huguenot Monument. Instead of wine, indulge in a chocolate tasting at Huguenot Fine Chocolates or a non-alcoholic 'gin' tasting at a distillery.
activities.halal_notes: A fun alternative to wine tasting. The town has a mosque (Franschhoek Masjid) for prayers.

activities.name: Franschhoek Motor Museum
activities.description: For something completely different in the Winelands, visit the Franschhoek Motor Museum. It showcases over 100 years of automotive history with a magnificent collection of vehicles. It's an impressive display for anyone interested in cars and engineering. Booking is essential.

activities.name: West Coast National Park
activities.description: Drive north up the R27 to the West Coast National Park (approx. 90-min drive). This park is a coastal wetland sanctuary, famous for its turquoise Langebaan Lagoon and incredible birdlife (including flamingos). In spring (Aug-Sep), the fields erupt in a carpet of wildflowers.

activities.name: Swim & Relax at Kraalbaai
activities.description: Inside the park, drive to Kraalbaai beach. The lagoon water here is calm, shallow, and much warmer than the Atlantic, making it the best swimming spot in the region. Relax on the pristine white sand or go for a dip in the stunningly clear turquoise water.
activities.halal_notes: Perfect spot for a picnic. Bring your own food and water.

activities.name: Atlantis Dunes Quad Biking
activities.description: On the way back from the West Coast, stop at the Atlantis Dunes for an adrenaline-pumping quad biking experience. Ride over vast white sand dunes, some towering up to 50 meters high. It's a thrilling adventure in a unique 'desert' landscape.
activities.transport_options: Located off the R27 on the way back to Cape Town.

activities.name: Sunset View & Dinner in Bloubergstrand
activities.description: End your day at Bloubergstrand for the iconic postcard view of Table Mountain. Watch the sunset and then have dinner at a beachfront restaurant like Ons Huisie, a heritage cottage serving local cuisine, enjoying the city lights across the bay.
activities.transport_options: Located on the way back to Cape Town.
activities.halal_notes: Ons Huisie has great seafood and vegetarian dishes; confirm cooking methods with them.

activities.name: Street Art & Design in Woodstock
activities.description: Spend the morning exploring the trendy suburb of Woodstock. Start at the Old Biscuit Mill to see the designer shops, then take a guided walking tour to discover the incredible, large-scale street art murals that have revitalized the area. It's a vibrant, creative hub.
activities.halal_notes: Woodstock has a large Muslim community; many halal food options are nearby for lunch.

activities.name: Lunch at District Café
activities.description: For lunch, stay in Woodstock and try District Café, a family-run halal restaurant known for its great food and welcoming atmosphere. It’s a perfect spot to refuel after exploring the street art.
activities.transport_options: Short Uber ride from Old Biscuit Mill.
activities.halal_notes: District Café is fully halal and a local favorite. [36]

activities.name: Esports Fun at ATK Arena
activities.description: For a change of pace, spend the afternoon at ATK Arena in Claremont, a state-of-the-art gaming and esports venue. Whether you're into PC gaming, consoles, or racing simulators, you can rent a station by the hour and have some competitive fun.
activities.halal_notes: A different kind of fun, great for a hot or rainy afternoon.

activities.name: Evening at Barcadia Arcade Bar
activities.description: In the evening, head to Barcadia on Hout Street. It's a retro arcade bar with classic games like Pac-Man, Street Fighter, and pinball machines. All games are free to play with a drink purchase. It's a fun, nostalgic night out.
activities.address: 62 Hout Street, Cape Town City Centre
activities.halal_notes: This is a bar (over 21s). They serve non-alcoholic drinks and pizza. Go for the games and atmosphere. [12]

activities.name: Cool Runnings Tobogganing
activities.description: Start the day with pure fun at Cool Runnings, Africa's only toboggan track. Ride a bobsled down a 1.25 km stainless steel track, controlling your own speed. It's a blast for adults and guaranteed to have you both laughing.
activities.halal_notes: The on-site cafe has simple food; check for halal status or plan to eat elsewhere. [6]

activities.name: Archery & Axe Throwing
activities.description: While in the Northern Suburbs, try your hand at something new. Venues like 'Warrior's Archery' or 'Valkyrie' offer sessions in archery and even axe throwing. It's a unique skill to learn and a lot of fun under expert supervision.
activities.transport_options: Short Uber/Bolt ride from Cool Runnings.

activities.name: GrandWest Entertainment Complex
activities.description: Spend the rest of the afternoon and evening at GrandWest. It's much more than a casino. Go ice skating at The Ice Station, play a round of laser tag, go bowling, and hit the arcade games at The Magic Company. There's enough here to keep you entertained for hours.
activities.halal_notes: GrandWest has multiple certified halal restaurants in its food court, including a Nando's and steers, as well as a dedicated prayer facility. [8]

activities.name: Oranjezicht City Farm Market
activities.description: Start your Saturday at the Oranjezicht City Farm Market at Granger Bay. This is a fantastic farmers' market with fresh local produce, artisanal foods, and amazing breakfast and brunch options. The vibe is relaxed and scenic, right by the ocean.
activities.halal_notes: Plenty of vegetarian, vegan, and fresh food options. Inquire with vendors about specific halal preparation. [9]

activities.name: Neighbourgoods Market at Old Biscuit Mill
activities.description: From one market to another! Head to the Neighbourgoods Market in Woodstock. This market is more of a bustling, trendy social hub with live music, designer goods, and an incredible array of street food stalls. It gets very busy, so be prepared for crowds.
activities.halal_notes: A great place to find unique halal or vegetarian street food. [11]

activities.name: Indoor Rock Climbing / Bouldering
activities.description: After the markets, challenge yourselves with some indoor rock climbing at CityROCK. They have extensive bouldering areas (no ropes) and high walls for roped climbing. It's a great workout and a fun way to do something active together, regardless of the weather.
activities.address: 9 Milner Street, Paarden Eiland, Cape Town

activities.name: Dinner & Board Games at Sword and Board
activities.description: For a chill and nerdy evening, head to Sword and Board, a hobby shop in the vibrant suburb of Observatory. On Saturday evenings, they often host game nights. Grab a delicious (and fully halal) pizza from 'The White Rabbit' next door and settle in for an evening of board games.
activities.address: 199 Lower Main Rd, Observatory, Cape Town
activities.halal_notes: The White Rabbit is a famous, fully halal eatery right next to the game shop, creating a perfect combo. [42]

activities.name: Bay Harbour Market
activities.description: If it's a Sunday (or Fri/Sat), the Bay Harbour Market in Hout Bay is a must-visit. Housed in a revamped fish factory, it has a fantastic atmosphere with live music, crackling fires, and over 100 stalls selling crafts, fashion, and delicious food.
activities.transport_options: Drive via the scenic coastal road (Victoria Road).
activities.halal_notes: A great place for brunch or lunch with many diverse food stalls.

activities.name: World of Birds Wildlife Sanctuary
activities.description: Located nearby in Hout Bay is the World of Birds, the largest bird park in Africa. Walk through large aviaries with over 3,000 birds. The highlight is the Monkey Jungle, where you can interact with playful squirrel monkeys.
activities.address: Valley Road, Hout Bay, Cape Town

activities.name: Galileo Open Air Cinema
activities.description: If your visit is during the summer months (Nov-Apr), end your Sunday with a movie under the stars at The Galileo Open Air Cinema. They have various venues, but the one at Kirstenbosch Gardens is magical. Arrive early, grab food from the on-site market, and relax on the grass before the movie starts.
activities.halal_notes: The on-site vendors offer a variety of food, including halal-friendly options.

activities.name: Indoor Go-Karting
activities.description: Spend your last morning with some high-speed fun at Century Karting, an indoor go-karting track. Race each other around the track for a final adrenaline rush. It's a great all-weather activity.
activities.address: Canal Walk, Century Boulevard, Century City
activities.halal_notes: Located at Canal Walk, so prayer facilities and halal food are easily accessible. [4, 8]

activities.name: Final Souvenir Shopping & Lunch
activities.description: After karting, do some last-minute souvenir shopping at Canal Walk or head back to the V&A Waterfront's Watershed market for locally made crafts. Enjoy a final relaxed lunch at a favourite spot or try something new.
activities.halal_notes: Both malls have excellent halal food options and prayer facilities. [37]

activities.name: Travel to Airport for Departure
activities.description: Head back to your hotel to collect your luggage and then make your way to Cape Town International Airport (CPT) for your flight home, filled with amazing memories of the Mother City.
activities.address: Your Hotel to Cape Town International Airport (CPT)
activities.halal_notes: Prayer facilities available at the airport.

activities.name: Leisurely Breakfast & Revisit a Favourite Spot
activities.description: Enjoy a slow final morning. Have a long breakfast at a beautiful cafe. Afterwards, choose a favourite spot to revisit for one last look – perhaps a final walk along the Sea Point promenade or a last visit to the colourful Bo-Kaap.

activities.name: Visit a Quirky Bookstore or Comic Shop
activities.description: Spend an hour browsing a unique local store. The Book Lounge in the CBD is a fantastic independent bookstore, or find a comic book store like Readers Den in Claremont for some nerdy fun before you leave.

activities.name: Final Lunch at Eastern Food Bazaar
activities.description: For a final, memorable, and delicious meal, head to the Eastern Food Bazaar. It's a bustling, canteen-style hall with an incredible array of authentic, flavourful, and budget-friendly food. A perfect encapsulation of Cape Town's diverse culture.
activities.address: 96 Longmarket St, Cape Town City Centre
activities.halal_notes: The entire bazaar is fully halal-certified. [3]

activities.name: Final Preparations & Departure
activities.description: After lunch, head to the hotel to pick up your luggage and travel to the airport for your departure, with a full stomach and happy memories.
activities.address: Your Hotel to Cape Town International Airport (CPT)
activities.halal_notes: Prayer facilities available at the airport.
